qas.question: Who released a guideline that recommends that people follow a whole plant food diet?
Which magazine also recommended that people follow a whole plant food diet?
In which year was there a cover article on the National Geographic regarding diet recommendations?
How many populations were studied and surveyed for the cover article?
Other than fruits and vegetables, what other product was highly recommended to be a part of a healthy diet?

context: The <a0_0>United Healthcare/Pacificare<a0_0/> nutrition guideline recommends a whole plant food diet, and recommends using protein only as a condiment with meals. A <a1_0>National Geographic<a1_0/> cover article from November <a2_0>2005<a2_0/>, entitled The Secrets of Living Longer, also recommends a whole plant food diet. The article is a lifestyle survey of <a3_0>three<a3_0/> populations, Sardinians, Okinawans, and Adventists, who generally display longevity and "suffer a fraction of the diseases that commonly kill people in other parts of the developed world, and enjoy more healthy years of life." In sum, they offer three sets of 'best practices' to emulate. The rest is up to you. In common with all three groups is to "Eat fruits, vegetables, and <a4_0>whole grains<a4_0/>."
